programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. Expect tight time allowed, flowing lines, and smart tactics on stride counts and anchor placement as title contenders push for pole.

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. A technical track, tight time allowed and related lines test precision and power, with the fastest clears advancing to a jump-off. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

Latvia will be the 72nd nation England have played an away match against – they’ve won their last three first time away games against a nation.

programme.title: Wales vs Belgium - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Wales are winless in five games against Belgium since winning 3-1 against them at EURO 2016 in the quarter-finals. Belgium have won six of their nine World Cup qualifying matches against Wales – their only defeat came in March 1993, losing 2-0 at Cardiff Arms Park.

programme.title: Wales vs Belgium - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8

programme.title: North. Ireland vs Germany - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Northern Ireland are winless in their last 13 matches against Germany, losing the last 10 in a row. They last beat them back in November 1983 in a European Championship qualifier. Germany have won seven of their nine away matches against Northern Ireland, winning the last five in a row and scoring 15 goals in the process. Their most recent visit was a 2-0 win in September 2019 in a European Championship qualifier.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab. Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam. The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Taffakur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. His love of Ramadan and belief that fasting elevates his game is a central theme of the final episode alongside detail of his early life, career and his unfaltering belief in Islam. programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Ummah
programme.desc: Ummah is an Arabic word meaning "community” – an important concept in Islam as it encourages Muslims to support and help each other especially in times of need. Zakat is one of the most important aspects in Islam - it is the principle of giving back to a community/person that needs it more than you. This episode will look into Zakat around footballers Ali-Al Hamadi and Nadia Nadim and the role it plays in their lives. Al-Hamadi is the first Iraqi to play in the Premier League with a remarkable back story – his family escaped persecution in their homeland in the early 2000s before settling, as refugees, in Liverpool. Suffering from extreme racism throughout his early life, doubts about his f

programme.title: North. Ireland vs Germany - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Northern Ireland are winless in their last 13 matches against Germany, losing the last 10 in a row. They last beat them back in November 1983 in a European Championship qualifier. Germany have won seven of their nine away matches against Northern Ireland, winning the last five in a row and scoring 15 goals in the process. Their most recent visit was a 2-0 win in September 2019 in a European Championship qualifier.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. Fot their supporters, each goal is a voice, each victory a declaration. Football it s a living emblem of unity, resilience and the unbreakable b

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Since completing a Premier League double over Manchester City in 2022-23, Brentford are winless in their last four against the Citizens in the division. programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Chelsea vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. programme.title: North. Ireland vs Germany - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Northern Ireland are winless in their last 13 matches against Germany, losing the last 10 in a row. They last beat them back in November 1983 in a European Championship qualifier. Germany have won seven of their nine away matches against Northern Ireland, winning the last five in a row and scoring 15 goals in the process. Their most recent visit was a 2-0 win in September 2019 in a European Championship qualifier.

programme.title: Qatar vs UAE - AFC Asian Qualifiers Road To 26 Playoffs - MD3
programme.desc: The fourth round of AFC 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualification matches take place over three days. The third-placed and fourth-placed teams from the third round were divided into two groups of three teams. Group A features Qatar, UAE & Oman and will play their matches in Qatar. The winners of each group will qualify directly for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, while the runners-up will advance to the fifth round.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. Fot their supporters, each goal is a voice, each victory a declaration. Football it s a living emblem of unity, resilience and the unbreakable b

programme.title: Aston Villa vs Burnley - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Aston Villa have won both of their last two Premier League games against Burnley but haven’t won more successive league meetings with the Clarets since March 1900. Burnley’s last league visit to Aston Villa saw them lose 3-2 in December 2023; they last lost successive away league matches at Villa in April 1966.

programme.title: Scotland vs Belarus - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Scotland have won three of their previous five meetings with Belarus, with each of those coming in World Cup qualifying – the most recent was just last month, with the Scots winning 2-0 in Belarus. This will be Belarus’ third trip to face Scotland, losing the first 4-1 in September 1997 before winning the most recent 1-0 in October 2005.

programme.title: Everton vs Crystal Palace - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match

programme.title: Wales vs Belgium - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Wales are winless in five games against Belgium since winning 3-1 against them at EURO 2016 in the quarter-finals. Belgium have won six of their nine World Cup qualifying matches against Wales – their only defeat came in March 1993, losing 2-0 at Cardiff Arms Park.

programme.title: Wales vs Belgium - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8

programme.title: Sevilla vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Sevilla have not won any of their last 19 LaLiga games against Barcelona, a run that stretches back to October 2015, losing their last seven in a row – their longest consecutive losing streak against the Catalans in the top-flight. Barcelona have avoided defeat in their last nine away LaLiga matches against Sevilla, their longest unbeaten run away to them in the competition.

programme.title: Sevilla vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Al-Ittihad and Shabab Al Ahli in AFC Champions League Elite history; teams from Saudi Arabia have won seven of their last eight games in the competition against teams from UAE, however, the one loss in this run was Al-Ittihad’s 1-2 loss to Al Wahda in their opening matchday of the 2025-26 season. programme.title: Melbourne City FC (AUS) vs Sanfrecce Hiroshima (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East M
programme.desc: This will be the first-ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Melbourne City and Sanfrecce Hiroshima; City are winless in each of their two games against Japanese opposition in the competition, while a win for Sanfrecce would see them beat Australian opponents in three consecutive games for the first time in competition history. Melbourne City are winless in each of their last three matches in the AFC Champions League Elite, their longest such run in the competition; in fact, they have begun each of their previous two campaigns in the competition with draws.

programme.title: Gangwon FC (KOR) vs Shanghai Shenhua FC (CHN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Gangwon and Shanghai Shenhua, with the former set to play their first-ever game in the competition; Shenhua have lost each of their last two matches against South Korean opposition in the Champions League Elite, another defeat here will see them equal their longest such run in competition history. Shanghai Shenhua lost their most recent AFC Champions League Elite match 0-4 to Kawasaki Frontale on 12 March 2025; failure to score against Gangwon will see them go scoreless in consecutive games for the first time in the competition since May 2011.

programme.title: Sharjah FC (UAE) vs Al Gharafa SC (QAT) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1

programme.title: Al Wahda FC (UAE) vs Al Ittihad Club (KSA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: Al Wahda are unbeaten in each of their last three AFC Champions League Elite matches against Al-Ittihad, having lost each of their three meetings in the competition prior to then; in fact, Al Wahda have scored five times in their last two games against Al-Ittihad in the competition, after failing to score even one goal in the first four such meetings between the two sides. programme.title: Race 2 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. The long front straight and technical infield reward grip and bravery, with braking into Parabólica and the drag to Turn 1 often settling it. Expect drafting trains, tyre-management gambles, and late lunges as title hopes to tighten in a full-throttle finale.

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: FC Seoul (KOR) vs Buriram United (THA) -AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: FC Seoul are unbeaten in each of their four meetings against Buriram United in the AFC Champions League Elite, including wins in each of their last two; in fact, FC Seoul have lost just one of their six meetings against Thai sides in the competition, with the loss coming in their most recent such game. programme.title: Chelsea vs Benfica - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2
programme.desc: Chelsea have won all four of their competitive meetings with Benfica, with the most recent of those coming earlier this year at the FIFA Club World Cup. This will be the first meeting between Chelsea and Benfica in the group/league phase of a competition, with the previous four all having come in the knockout stages: UEFA Champions League quarter-finals in 2011-12, UEFA Europa League final in 2012-13 and the FIFA Club World Cup last 16 earlier this year.

programme.title: Race 2 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. The long front straight and technical infield reward grip and bravery, with braking into Parabólica and the drag to Turn 1 often settling it. Expect drafting trains, tyre-management gambles, and late lunges as title hopes to tighten in a full-throttle finale.

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: Napoli vs Sporting Clube de Portugal - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2
programme.desc: The two previous meetings between Napoli and Sporting CP have both finished 0-0, with both coming in the first round of the 1989-90 UEFA Cup first round. Napoli have won all four of their UEFA Champions League matches against Portuguese sides, beating Benfica twice in 2016-17 and Braga twice in 2023-24.

programme.title: Valentin Vacherot (MON) vs Arthur Rinderknech (FRA) - Final - Rolex Shanghai Masters ATP 1000
programme.desc: Valentin Vacherot (MON) vs Arthur Rinderknech (FRA). First cousins meet in a historic Masters final after shock runs—qualifier Vacherot beat Djokovic; Rinderknech upset Medvedev to reach his first Masters title match. A family affair with big serves and fearless baseline hitting—expect tight sets and high drama in Shanghai.

programme.title: Arturo Coello (ESP) / Agustin Tapia (ARG) vs Federico Chingotto (ARG) / Alejandro Galan (ESP) - Men
programme.desc: Top seeds Arturo Coello/Agustín Tapia clash with No.2 Alejandro Galán/Federico Chingotto. Coello/Tapia dominated most of 2025, but Galán/Chingotto struck back with victory in Germany P2. Head-to-head favors Coello/Tapia, yet momentum is split after recent meetings. Indoor conditions at Rotterdam Ahoy amplify aggressive volleys and x-3 smashes, setting up a high-stakes P1 decider.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: M1 -ATP 250 - European open 2025 - Brussels
programme.desc: ATP 250 European Open 2025 (10th edition) debuts in Brussels after nine years in Antwerp, staged on indoor-hard courts at Brussels Expo (Palais 12), 13–19 Oct. Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano finale. Championship hopefuls chase maximum points as fatigue, tyre life and track limits shape the last attacks. A strong launch, disciplined braking at Quercia and perfect traction from Tramonto decide podiums. Anticipate safety-car drama, photo-finish drafts to the stripe, and decisive moves under pressure as the round closes with a flat-out sprint.

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
programme.desc: Extreme H World Cup hits Qiddiya for a desert race. Hydrogen-powered Pioneer 25 SUVs face Time Trials, head-to-head heats, and a multi-car Grand Final, with energy management, tyre wear and route choice deciding positions. Expect dunes, dust and daring passes under the Tuwaiq cliffs, driver switches, and strategy on boost usage as teams chase points, manufacturer bragging rights and momentum in the sport’s new zero-emissions era. Broadcast highlights and on-board shots bring the action home.

programme.title: Qatar Club vs Al Shahania - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W5
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Nîmes vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: The Art of lighting the Asian Games Flame
programme.desc: The Asian Games torch lighting has become a stage for innovation, blending tradition with modern spectacle. From iconic moments to dazzling surprises, none stand out more than Doha 2006 with its dramatic horse and rider. As the 2026 Games approach in Japan, anticipation grows for the next unforgettable torch lighting ceremony.

programme.title: The Art of lighting the Asian Games Flame

programme.title: Al Wakrah vs Um Salal - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W6
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. programme.title: Nîmes vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Zizou BERGS (BEL) vs Raphael COLLIGNON (BEL) - ATP 250 - European open 2025 - Brussels
programme.desc: ATP 250 European Open 2025 (10th edition) debuts in Brussels after nine years in Antwerp, staged on indoor-hard courts at Brussels Expo (Palais 12), 13–19 Oct. Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

programme.title: Mark LAJAL (EST) vs Tomas Martin ETCHEVERRY (ARG) - ATP 250 - BNP Paribas Nordic Open - Stockholm 20
programme.desc: Stockholm (13–19 Oct). Indoor hard at Kungliga Tennishallen. Draws: 28 singles / 16 doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis — big serves, sharp returns, and tight tie-breaks. Home favorites and rising talents push for autumn ranking points and a Sunday trophy.
